intro: Lawia ceylanica var. konkanica, commonly known as the Konkan lawia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. It has elliptical leaves with a smooth texture and emits a mild fragrance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
